com.radirius.mercury.framework

Class Runner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.framework.Runner

  • public class Runner
extends Object
    The heart of Mercury. Runs the Core and provides all of the various materials required for your game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean initialized
      Whether the runner is initialized.
      boolean running
      Whether or not the Runner is running.

      • getInstance

        public static Runner getInstance()
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of Runner.

      • init

        public void init(Core core,
        int width,
        int height,
        boolean fullscreen,
        boolean vsync,
        boolean multithread,
        boolean devConsole,
        boolean showDebug,
        boolean showExtraDebug,
        int targetFps)
        Initializes the library
        Parameters:
        core - The Core to be ran.
        width - The width of the display.
        height - The height of the display.
        fullscreen - Whether or not fullscreen is enabled.
        vsync - Whether or not v-sync is enabled.
        multithread - Whether or not the Core is initialized on a separate thread.
        devConsole - Whether or not the developers console is enabled.
        targetFps - The target framerate.

      • run

        public void run()
        The main game loop.

        Returns:
        The framerate.

        Parameters:

      • showDebug

        public void showDebug(boolean showDebug)
        Sets whether or not debug data should be displayed.
        Parameters:
        showDebug - Whether or not debug info is to be shown onscreen.

      • addDebugData

        public void addDebugData(String name,
                String value)
        Adds information to the debugdata. Debug data is wiped every single update frame, so this is to be called every frame.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the debug information.
        value - The value of the debug information.

        public void setIcon(InputStream... icons)
        Sets the icon for given size(s). Recommended sizes that you should put in are x16, x32, and x64.
        Parameters:
        icons - Icon(s) for the game.
